title: Redesign the entire UI to match the provided game-like reference design

requirements.text: Redesign the app’s global visual theme to feel like a mobile game UI (dark, high-contrast, glossy cards, neon accents, soft gradients, and subtle depth), using the uploaded reference image as the primary style guide, and apply it consistently across all pages and dialogs.

quotes: It look like website to me not like a game to me

acceptanceCriteria: All main pages (Home, Tasks, Reminders, Rewards, Story, Avatar, Quests, Leaderboard, Insights, History, Settings) share a cohesive game-like theme (dark background, elevated panels/cards, accent glow/gradient, consistent typography).
The app no longer presents as a plain website UI (flat white cards, standard dashboard look); it visually matches the uploaded reference style at a glance.
Theme works in both desktop and mobile layouts without broken spacing, overflow, or unreadable text.

requirements.text: Update global styling tokens (CSS variables / Tailwind theme usage) to support the reference-style dark UI: define a dark-first palette with purple/magenta accents, improved card elevation, borders, and glow states; ensure primary/secondary/destructive/chart colors look consistent with the new game aesthetic.
acceptanceCriteria: The default look in dark mode matches the reference vibe (dark background, bright accent buttons/badges, visible depth).
Interactive elements have clear hover/active/focus states that fit the theme (e.g., gentle glow, brighter border, or lift).
Text contrast meets readability expectations (no low-contrast muted text on dark surfaces in key areas).

requirements.text: Redesign the main layout (header + navigation + page container) into a game-like HUD: compact, stylized header; navigation that feels like a game menu; and a content area that uses stacked panels/cards similar to the reference image.

quotes: It look like website to me not like a game to me

acceptanceCriteria: AppLayout header and navigation visually read as a game HUD/menu rather than a standard website navbar/sidebar.
Navigation active state is clearly game-like (e.g., highlighted pill/tab, glow, or accent frame) and consistent across routes.
Layout remains responsive: mobile menu still works and feels consistent with the redesigned style.

requirements.text: Redesign the Home page dashboard to match the reference image’s structure and hierarchy: player/profile panel, level/XP progress bar, streak panel, coin panel, and a prominent ‘Today’s Tasks’ section with a strong primary CTA.
acceptanceCriteria: Home page presents a top-to-bottom ‘game dashboard’ flow (profile/title, level XP bar, streak, coins, then today’s tasks).
Primary call-to-action for starting/doing tasks is visually prominent and aligned to the accent color style from the reference.
Home page uses richer surfaces (gradients, overlays, soft shadows) and avoids plain stats cards that read like a generic admin dashboard.

requirements.text: Restyle task presentation components to match the game-like card style: TaskCard, task lists, and task actions should use compact badges, accent chips, and a bold primary action button similar to the reference design.

quotes: It look like website to me not like a game to me

acceptanceCriteria: Task cards visually resemble the reference (dark panels, clear badge chips, consistent spacing, and a standout action button).
Priority/category/duration indicators use themed chips/badges consistent with the new palette.
No functional regression: complete/edit/delete actions continue to work as before.

requirements.text: Enhance celebratory and progression UI to feel more game-like: restyle reward celebration overlays, progress bars, and badges to match the new aesthetic (glow, depth, and a ‘loot/reward’ feel) while keeping motion respectful of reduced-motion settings.

quotes: It look like website to me not like a game to me

acceptanceCriteria: Reward celebration overlay looks like an in-game reward pop-up (not a plain modal) and matches the new theme.
Animations and effects are present but subtle; reduced-motion preference disables/limits animations per existing global CSS behavior.
Progress UI (e.g., XP) uses a more game-like bar presentation consistent across the app.

requirements.text: Add the required generated images as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and reference them from the UI where appropriate (do not serve images through the backend).
acceptanceCriteria: All required images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated with the exact filenames specified in this build request.
The UI references these images via static paths (e.g., /assets/generated/...) and does not require backend endpoints for them.
At minimum, the logo mark is used in the header (already present) and the remaining assets are available for use in relevant pages without broken links.

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or any files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose them instead).
Keep the backend as a single Motoko actor; this request is UI-only and must not require backend schema or API changes.
Use English for any user-facing text.
nonGoals: Implementing new backend features, new data models, or changing reward/task/reminder logic.
Adding real-time features (WebSockets) or third-party auth beyond Internet Identity.
Pixel-perfect duplication of the reference; the goal is to match the overall game-like aesthetic and hierarchy.

required: Productivity mascot character, friendly but not childish (mascot.dim_1024x1024.png)
Set of 12 badge icons with a consistent style (badges-sprite.dim_2048x2048.png)
Weekly reward chest illustration, closed state (weekly-chest-closed.dim_1024x1024.png)
Weekly reward chest illustration, open state (weekly-chest-open.dim_1024x1024.png)
App logo mark, simple and high-contrast (logo-mark.dim_512x512.png)
